name: Park Hyatt Washington

reviews.text: It's generally hard to fault this hotel. The room was spacious, consisting of separate sleeping and sitting areas and a very smart modern bathroom. Good strong air conditioning and overall efficient, friendly service. Nice position with central Washington and Georgetown within easy walking distance.
reviews.title: Overall hard to beat - but a few quirks

reviews.text: A few issues though. Hotels should I think be careful not to make any of their systems so complex that they defeat guests. The rooms have complicated light control systems with a lot of the switches controlling dimming/brightening as opposed to on/off. I never figured them out and ended up sleeping with some of them on. Of course I could have asked somebody to come and explain them but somehow there was never time and in any case it shouldn't be necessary. Also there were no electric plugs easily accessible on either side of the bed which was a bit tiresome.
reviews.title: Warning....You May Not Want To Leave the Hotel!!

reviews.text: Service staff perhaps need a bit more training. I ordered Earl Grey tea in the room and it was delivered with a jar of hot milk, which seemed especially odd in an establishment that prides itself on its knowledge of tea. In the downstairs restaurant, the staff hadn't heard of a Cafe Moccha and consequently it took thirty minutes to arrive.
reviews.title: Elegant, welcoming, Well Situated Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And for a big hotel the business centre seems too small - a small room with two computers - even with I think a third one available this just wasn't enough for the demand during a busy conference.
reviews.title: Awesome!

reviews.text: Overall though a comfortable, well-run hotel in central Washington.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a short, but memorable, extended weekend trip. I hadn't visited DC since I was a kid and wanted to stay somewhere luxurious and yet outside of the Capitol Hill hubbub. This is the perfect retreat for those who don't mind the short walk (30-45 minutes; 10 minute walk to the nearest Metro station) to the more popular sights and museums.
reviews.title: A DC Standard

reviews.text: We were automatically upgraded to a tremendous suite with an extra half-bathroom and sitting area. A generous, "American-style" breakfast is included with any AAA membership. The hotel is located just a couple blocks away from Georgetown's superb shopping district-- a charming stretch of shops and eateries, with rustic views of the nearby river and canal. We also fell in love with nearby Embassy Row, riding bikes (provided by the hotel) to explore the district's gorgeous townhouses. Dinner at the hotel's Blue Duck Tavern was especially tasty, though I'd recommend sharing side dishes and appetizers rather than limiting yourself to the less interesting main courses.
reviews.title: Lovely stay

reviews.text: The staff was incredibly gracious, and the accomodations were magnificent. The look and feel of the hotel is sumptuous without being overbearing. (There is also a well-equipped fitness center and pool/jacuzzi area, but I'll have to check out those amenities on my next trip.) My only kvetch is that house cars are only available on weekdays. I understand that many visitors leave DC on the weekends, but can't a five-star establishment afford to keep at least one housecar on hand for weekend guests? This issue aside, I won't be straying from the Park Hyatt on any of my future trips to DC.
reviews.title: Very stylish hotel with great rooms but not-so-great breakfeast buffet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently had 2 weeks here and it was a great place to stay. The room was comfortable especially the bed and bathroom. And it was spotless. However the breakfast service left a disappointing edge. Still not something that would prevent me from recommending this lovely hotel. The staff were very helpful and accommodating. And the Blue Duck Tavern is a great restaurant. Stay here!
reviews.title: Awesome!!

reviews.text: The Park Hyatt is a wonderful, luxurious and very stylish hotel, in a good DC location. Service staff are very helfpul and friendly. The only reason why I withhold one star in my rating is the breakfast. First: The tables are rather small and not very comfortable. Secondly: I'm the kind of guy who appreciates an opulent breakfast buffet with lots of options to choose from and something different to try each day. The Hyatt offers a rather slim buffet (top-notch-quality food indeed, everything organic, good bread, etc.) and a menu to order from.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and location in West End

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first stay at a Park Hyatt and we are in love. My husband and I stayed here when we were in DC for a wedding on August 17-19, 2012.
reviews.title: Perfection.

reviews.text: The best way I can describe the superb experience of staying here is that it was like the hotel was thoughtfully designed to be as efficient and unannoying as possible, and that the staff was trained to be as unobtrusively helpful, competent and friendly as possible. It's rare for a hotel stay to be completely free of any annoyances whatsoever but this place killed it. It's like a sleek, unstuffy-fied version of a certain old school 5 star hotel, in terms of service, yet at a completely reasonable price point. I got the feeling that if I called the front desk and asked for a "single plum floating in perfume in a man's hat" (yes, that's a Simpsons reference), it would not faze anyone, and someone would make that happen post haste.
reviews.title: Well located with service that requires an upgrade.

reviews.text: What Makes This Place Awesome in Every Way:
reviews.title: Only an excellent rating is fair - if you compare it to many hotels in the US - but the Internet is a seperate story..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Incredibly FAST and efficient checkin and checkout process. The staff member at the front desk who checked us in even offered to add me to the rewards program so I could get extra miles on my United card.
reviews.title: Great hotel, perfect stay
Modern and Clean: Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: Valet service is fast and friendly and you can call the front desk to have the car waiting for you if you're in a hurry. Altogether (with taxes and fees and whatnot), parking comes to a hair under 50 bucks a day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay this year… I ADORE this hotel! The staff was welcoming & eager to assist with anything you might have needed, from the moment we walked up to the entrance.
reviews.title: An Oasis of Relaxation in the City
Guard Your Wallet Against "The Hyatt Touch"
reviews.text: We live in the area & have stayed here for “mini escapes” just to unwind. The location is convenient for accessing many of DC’s neighborhoods, especially Dupont Circle & Georgetown. We tend to park our car and just walk around to wherever we are heading.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The décor is a wonderful mix of modern, minimalist & Americana. This was, for me, the best way to present the “Americana” style.
reviews.title: Excellent service and location

reviews.text: The rooms are beautifully appointed with a relaxing, neutral color palette and an excellent attention to details. We have stayed in the Premier Park Deluxe rooms both times. They are more like apartments (minus a kitchen) than hotel rooms. We chose this category of room primarily for the large wonderful bathrooms. Deep soaking tubs, walk-in rain showers & dimmable lighting are the highlight of the bathrooms… but the vanity area & convenient, well organized closet area are pluses as well. The color scheme again is neutral… and the stone tiles were a deep, dark espresso brown. This color will not be loved by everyone… I am certain some feel it is too dark… but I loved it for the relaxing nature of it and again, the lights are adjustable. The dark tile is accented with light wood and whites. The toiletries are amongst my most favorite anywhere… Le Labo products… and in an incredible scent combination (grapefruit, amber & musk) that both my husband & I love. It is a scent that is fresh & neither feminine nor masculine in a heavy way. Another “nice touch” was the iPhone/ iPod player & charger… although I cannot recall the brand name, it had great quality sound for listening to music.
reviews.title: Elegantly Subtle and Accomodating

reviews.text: The pool & fitness center are lovely. The fitness center follows the hotel's design scheme and is so well appointed that it makes you WANT to workout! From chilled towels to lemon infused water & lots of daylight… the details have been attended to! The pool area is very comfortable and relaxing. The hot tub (with skylight above it) is great… however during our first stay (in February) it was a teeny bit too hot… and this time MUCH too cool to have the benefits it should have on one’s muscles. We agreed that the hotter temperature was much preferred. We are hoping that this is rectified before our next stay! It could also be a tad cleaner.
reviews.title: great city hotel with great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: just spent a weekend at this property and was overall very happy. We had a Park Deluxe room which was spacious with a sitting area and bedroom. The bed was fabulous. The decor of the room was very modern and sparse but nice. The bathroom was great - very nice soaking tub and open shower which was interesting.
reviews.title: very pleased

reviews.text: Housekeeping was good but a bit inconsistent. At turndown they didn't take room service from earlier in the day, but folded all of the clothes we had left out.
reviews.title: almost perfect experience

reviews.text: We don't usually stay in Park Hyatts and chose this on the strength of its strong TA reviews, coupled with its Cherry Blossom roomrate that knocked the spots off the neighbouring Ritz Carlton and Four Seasons in Georgetown (these would be our usual hotels of choice)!
reviews.title: A chic city choice

likes.liked: — Good size of room, excellent rate and good service
likes.disliked: — Poor storage and sleeping area felt cramped

reviews.text: The Park Hyatt is a striking design throughout (though a bit too stark for my taste). As other reviewers have commented: bathroom fabulous; storage poor. I also found the layout (a partial division between bed and living area) made the sleeping area feel a bit cramped.
reviews.title: Flawless

likes.disliked: — This is really digging to find a problem, but the pillows were a little hard for feather pillows.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very clean, quiet, had fresh flowers and excellent sheets and towels. The entire property is beautifully maintained and stylish.
reviews.title: Great hotel, Amazing rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I also found the staff to be of a very high standard and would give this hotel my award for the "best coffee served in the US" (I usually find American coffee horribly weak, but at the Park Hyatt they served an excellent Italian brew).
reviews.title: Great hotel - hugely recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a good city hotel and I would recommend it to people who like sophisticated, chic hotels. I would also certainly consider Park Hyatts in other cities on the strength of this experience.
reviews.title: WOW!!!

likes.disliked: — Minor design issues with the suite we occupied

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have choosen this hotel for our 4 nights stay in Washington D.C. based on reviews on "Tripadvisor" and room advice on "TripKick" and made the booking via the hotel site, section "special offers". During the period of our stay (July 23 to 27), there was a time limited 25% off promotion with a 14 days firm advance booking. As our schedule was set, this was convenient to us.
reviews.title: A Zen experience that could easily be perfect

likes.disliked: — The Blue Duck chef de service

reviews.text: Upon confirmation of booking, e-concierge offered various incrementals. We have chosen two restaurant visits, the in-house Blue Duck Tavern and the nearby Filomena, which were confirmed by return.
reviews.title: Great Family Vacation!

reviews.text: After a delayed late night Amtrak arrival from NYC and a half hour line for a cab at Union Station watching pouring the rain, we were happy to be expected by reception and that the room we had asked for was still available. It was already midnight, but the room was so immaculate that we took out our pocket Canon for a few non flash shoots.
reviews.title: Wonderful Place to Stay!

reviews.text: Our stay was as expected: a very pleasant, spacious room with a Zen bath and shower experience, friendly staff, nice meals and drinks and a check-out as smooth as the check-in. A special mention for the Japanese receptionist that proposed to email us the answer to a very secondary question she would have to investigate as well as for the lounge waitresses that were very welcoming during breakfast and cocktails.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Washington D.C.

likes.liked: — The hotel's accommodations, service, food, and location
likes.disliked: — The only negative was that the bathrooms do not have any place to hang towels.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some reviewers criticized the fact that the dressing is in the bathroom. We found it on the contrary interesting to get dressed up in accordance with the progress in the bathroom, however, it did bother us that there is no door to the toilet section. We think that a smoked glass door could easily be fixed to provide the necessary privacy.
reviews.title: Great option

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While the room itself was quite nice, I wouldn't say it was especially fantastic, but the hotel staff are among the best I have ever encountered. From reception to the restaurant to the bell staff, the staff were absolutely fantastic. They are clearly very well trained and that is a compliment to the management as this type of service is clearly attainable in the hotel business, but rarely seen. The individual at reception made a point of calling me by name during the length of our stay. We went to visit the breakfast area and the individual there made a point of showing us around and what they offered. I never opened a door for myself once during the stay. Housekeeping was invisible, but yet very efficient in their task. The complimentary car service was a great help during our stay. The room had everything we needed including excellent towels and bath salts. The location of the hotel was about a 7 minute walk to the subway and a relatively easy walk to Georgetown. It is about a $6-7 cab ride to the Lincoln Memorial and about $12 to the White House. The breakfast was quite good, but was slightly expensive if you were paying yourself (try to find a package that includes the breakfast). Regardless, I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone staying in Washington.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: Spent a weekend here for some R & R, perfect location, close enough to Georgetown for all of the shopping and dining yet far enough away for peace and quiet. Pool and gym facilities were very nice. Great service, friendly, professional staff. Our AAA rate included delicious breakfast at the Blue Duck. Would stay here again if the price is right.
reviews.title: Very very nice hotel in a good location

reviews.text: I require crutches or a wheelchair for walking so I am quite sensitive to, and aware of issues relating to disability. My accessible room was fantastic and comfortable and all good things, in particular the fact that the bed was easy to get into unlike so many other high end hotels which have caused me no end of problems. The only issue was the shower and the problem was not unique to the Park Hyatt. I don't know if hotels have people with disabilities look at their accessible rooms, but if they don't then they should. The bathing area in my room was fantastic- it had a rainshower head in the ceiling, a handshower on the wall, and a soaking tub in a marble surround. Gorgeous! And there were handrails available on the walls, but there was no place to sit while using the handshower. If hotels have shower chairs it would be great to let the guest know these are available because I have called front desks before and been told that they did not know if the hotel had shower seats. I imagine that would not have been true here, but it would be so helpful if there could be some information card that identified the particulars of the room and identified devices that may be available if needed. i.e. TTY, shower chairs, braille hotel information or a particular channel with audio information.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel but some drawbacks if you have mobility problems

reviews.text: However, I did ask the desk clerk about the fitness area and pool I was told to take the elevator to the 3rd floor and follow the signs to the health club. I was standing in front of her with my crutches when I asked this so I followed her directions only to find myself standing in front of a door with a sign pointing to the health club which was one flight down. Definitely not easily accessible with crutches. I went back downstairs, where there was a different person at the desk, who apologized and told me to walk across the street to another building and take the elevator up to the health club. Prior to booking the hotel I asked about the pool and was told it was accessible, but when I arrived I discovered that the only way to get into/out of the pool was via ladders on the side of the pool. These are not truly accessible for people who have limited use of their feet and legs. The equipment in the fitness center was a mixed bag for people with disabilities.
reviews.title: Top-notch across the board!

reviews.text: In spite of these drawbacks I would stay here again in a minute...it was wonderful and I agree with other reviewers. The staff could not have been nicer, but please make sure they are sensitive to the needs of people with disabilities- as in stairs are difficult for some of us.
reviews.title: Best in the West End

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived and greeted by Kevin at the door – we were immediately offered bottled water because of the extreme heat and taken to the check in desk. Here Sergey took over, dealing with us professionally and efficiently, answering all our questions and then upgrading our room because there was a better room available. Morning greetings were the same – as soon as we came off of the elevator we were greeted with staff members wishing us good morning. And the concierge Shane – outstanding service. Took time to understand what we wanted from our vacation and not only came up with wonderful suggestions –from what to do during the day to getting us into fully booked restaurants at night. Shane even had great recommendations for the second leg of our trip to New Orleans. A hotel is as good as its staff and this hotel gets a six star rating for its personnel.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A business hotel but service was wonderful and the location is quiet. Very close to Georgetown and quite a way from the mall. We enjoyed the walk though or the metro ride. The hotel was exceptionally clean and modern. Food was great although we just ate breakfast here and had drinks and apps. They don't provide a top sheet..never had that happen before...but were quick to add one for us. We'd stay there again but not on the 4th. Checked that off the bucket list!!
reviews.title: July 4th in a Great City and Hotel

reviews.text: We loved our stay at the Park Hyatt. Our suite was impeccable. In advance of our arrival, the hotel had set up a nice wooden crib (MUCH nicer than hotels typically have) for our baby (complete with a "baby welcome pack" including Bumble&Bumble baby bath products). We couldn't have asked for better service - we were able to check in early, and the front desk was very helpful in general with our questions/requests. I would absolutely stay here again.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel with Top-Notch Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed two weekend nights at this hotel. The location is very good, on a relatively quiet street, just a short walk from Georgetown and from the Metro, and a slightly longer walk from Dupont Circle.
reviews.title: Excellent in all ways

reviews.text: The decor is fresh and modern but warm. The service is friendly and very helpful. Our room (an upgrade) was spacious and very comfortable and well-designed, with a great mattress, no noise, and a double sink in the bathroom. We especially liked the large walk-in shower, really a room in itself.
reviews.title: quaint hotel in georgetown...., the best place to stay in D.C.

reviews.text: We have just returned from staying 3 nights nights at this well-located property in the "West End" area of Washington DC (between Foggy Bottom and Georgetown).The hotel is very up-scale,minimalist contemporary in style ,with an attitude problem to match! The most accomodating personnel are the bell staff. There are several similar properties in the immediate area,any one of which we would definitely consider and book in a future stay in this city.Based on our irritating reception from staff and managers,"trained" to handle problems, we would definitely never suggest this hotel.
reviews.title: Would not recommend!

reviews.text: The Park Hyatt Washington, DC is a true gem. Everything is done with an attention to detail. The rooms are exceptionally well-maintained, all of the staff provide that "extra touch," and the whole design is clean, simple, and subtly luxurious. Whenever you place a call to the staff, the phone is rarely ever answered after one ring. I had a Park King room, which was very sizable. The staff also provides up-to-date DC lifestyle magazines within all of the rooms. All of the rooms feature flat-panel Sharp AQUOS televisions that show a great picture. The bath amenities are by Blaise Mautin, an up-and-coming Parisian who has custom-designed a scent for the Park Hyatt Washington. One can actually smell his talent throughout the whole hotel.
reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing

likes.liked: — The design of the hotel, and simple luxury.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I had an AMAZING experience. As a DC area native, this might be the BEST if not THE BEST luxury hotel in Washington, DC.
reviews.title: The room and bathroom were AMAZING!
Sweet surprise
reviews.text: We booked our stay with two reward nights. Simply put, the hotel room was amazing and beautiful.
Upon check-in, we were greated and given our room keys, to this point everything looked nice.
reviews.title: Nice, very nice

likes.disliked: — The price, which I can only justify on special occasions.

reviews.text: Our son named this the best place we stayed on our recent trip. You step off the street into an oasis. We were back at the Hyatt as compensation for a very seriously bad experience I had there in teh SPring. This time around they were set to impress. There was a myraid of staff ready to serve you. Our room was spacious, were were in a junior King suite. The bathroom was amazing with a walk in rain shower and jacuzzi bath, a spacious sink and counter area, and a walk in wardrobe area with lots space to unpack and store luggage. This allowed the living room area to be used as just that. Our son marvelled at the TV that swivelled between the living room area and the bedroom.
reviews.title: A stay in Paradise

reviews.text: We had dinner and breakfast in the Blue Duck Tavern. Every meal was sumptous and full of wonderful flavours.
reviews.title: The Park Hyatt should have been so much better
Flawed
reviews.text: There were some diappointments as the room was not set up full the way it shoudl have been and there is one server that is a problem. He works the mornign and lunch shifts. Not sure if he is a seinior person or not. Oh well we survived. and enjoyed a lovely visit.

I have stayed at this hotel before and in the past this hotel was much better. This last weekend I was in a room with a shared door. The room next door was having a loud party all night. All the noise came through the door and you could hear everything. The front desk said they would handle the situation and did not. Needless to say it was not a good night. After finally getting to sleep at 3 pm the trash truck woke me up at five. In addition, this room had an extemely hard mattress and poor pillows. On the positive side this hotel has a nice workout facility, excellent location and great bar.
reviews.title: The BlueDuck Tavern had the worst food and service I have experienced in a long time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This stay should have been so much more. When I checked out the front desk said the general manager would contact me. This has not happened.
reviews.title: Modern, Inviting, and Essentially Flawless

reviews.text: Little to say beyond the other five star reviews: excellent service, palatial bathrooms, and well appointed rooms and public areas. All the staff is particularly warm. Breakfast at the Blue Duck Tavern is a must - their eggs are the freshest and best tasting I have ever tried.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Problems - On my last stay I booked a Park Suite and was given one on the top floor that had an odd layout and seemed less than the advertised 1060 sq. feet. It also lacked a work desk, which was particularly irritating on a work trip, and the A/C occasionally shut off for a few minutes to blow hot humid air. Next time I'll request another room if this occurs.
reviews.title: We have favorite hotels all over the world - and now we have one in DC!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, however, this will be my hotel of choice for most business trips to DC, except for the times I have business very close to the St. Regis.
reviews.title: Amazing Experience. Is there a Sixth Star, so that I can give it to the Park Hyatt DC

reviews.text: My husband and I have favorite hotels all over the world - and now we have one in DC. Our first class experience began before we even reached the hotel. I realized (with panic) that I had forgotten to get tickets to the Holcaust Museum, and tickets were no longer available on the internet. I called the Park Hyatt to speak with the Concierge, prepared to beg for assistance. Instead, Andrea at the front desk, who answered my call, assured me that two tickets to the Holocaust Museum would be waiting for us at the front desk upon check-in.
reviews.title: A true five star experience

reviews.text: And they were. Along with the pleasant surprise that our room was being upgraded, and that we could bring our luggage up to the room immediately, many hours before the official check-in time.
reviews.title: Nice - like the other reviews say

description: Park Hyatt Washington, located in the fashionable West End Georgetown neighborhood of the nation's capital, combines sophisticated modernism with classic American style. With its Tea Cellar offering rare and vintage tea selections, intimate Spa Room offering an array of services and treatments, redesigned flexible event and meeting space, and celebrated Blue Duck Tavern restaurant, Park Hyatt Washington offers guests a unique experience in the nation's capital.
